text:
*dynamic rss_listing url based on contact property*

I want to dynamically set the url of an rss feed module in an email. If I hardcode the URL it works, eg:

```{% set feedURL = "<https://example.com/computing/feed/>" %}

{% rss_listing
    rss_url={{feedURL}},
    is_external="true",
    number_of_items="999"
%}```
but if I dynamically set the URL using a contact property it doesnâ€™t work. eg:
```{% set feedURL = "<https://example.com/>"~contact.category.value~"/feed/" %}

{# feedURL|print returns "<https://example.com/computing/feed/>" #}

{% rss_listing
    rss_url={{feedURL}},
    is_external="true",
    number_of_items="999"
%}```

HubSpot changed some Outlook if statements in their DND modules. Here is an example from a default HubSpot template. I have forwarded this to our contractors to work with HubSpot to resolve. Here is a diff of before and after that I believe to be breaking it that is immediately after the hse-column-container div elements that changed that I think is breaking:

`97,100c90,91`
`<  <!--[if (mso)|(IE)]>`
`< <td valign="top" style="width:600px;">`
`< <![endif]-->`
`< <!--[if gte mso 9]>`
`---`
`>  <!--[if true]>`
`> <td valign="top" style="width:600px;">`
thank you I'll share in our ticket
